name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Vancouver Downtown

reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in central location.
reviews.text: I always try to use the Holiday Inn brand of hotels and found this one to be very central for getting about Vancouver. The check-in wasn't great, the staff didn't seem to know what they were doing. I had to sign to agree that I would be fined if I smoked in the bedroom and when I got to the bedroom, it smelt very strongly of cigarettes, so I asked to change room and this was done. The room was very comfortable with 2 large double beds and a nice bathroom. The dinner menu was a quite limited, we would have gone out if it hadn't been pouring with rain, but the food we had was good. The bar service was excellent, with a very helpful member of staff. I would return again as apart from the initial impressions, we had a good stay.

reviews.title: Centrally located hotel!
reviews.text: If you are looking for a hotel that is walking distance to shopping and nightlife in Vancouver, this hotel is a perfect place. Hotel needs some updating for being a Holiday Inn, still a great location you can't beat.

reviews.title: Cold Vancouver
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights and it's a great location in central Vancouver for getting about the city, the room was clean, bright and airy. staff are very helpful and polite. Would recomend this hotel to friends and family. I would stay here again if I were coming back to Vancouver.

reviews.title: Great staff, comfortable rooms
reviews.text: I was attending a local trade show and chose this hotel for two nights due to the great price and downtown location. The staff was very courteous and we were pleased with the comfortable suite we were given. This hotel is very close to many attractions and we were able to shop, dine, and take in the Granville Market, Gas Town, and the waterfront all on foot. Thank you, we will certainly return next visit!

reviews.title: Very good room, friendly staff
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel at the end of October 2012 . The room on the 6th floor was large, well equipped and very comfortable . I was offered free parking on Priority points but I did not require same. The lady on the tourist information desk in the lobby was most helpful and informative . The barman on duty was chatty and had all the guests chatting. Breakfast however not included .

Checked in. Had reservation for 2 queen beds. Was given 2 doubles. Faced the back alley. Crack heads and bums in plain view. Demanded 2 queens and a room facing the street. Was given a coupon for 2 free breakfasts for the mix up. Breakfast buffet was aweful. Cold chalky hashbrowns,and greese laden burnt bacon. Parkade is just terrible, and the elevators with respect to the parkade, and the lobby is a maze and inconvenient. Pool had a foul, sour odor.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: On the bright side........the rooms are absolutely spotless, clean, and comforable. In a nut shell, wouldnt stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location, good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here with 3 other couples, some business & some pleasure. Good location, we were able to walk to shopping & restaurants. You can tell it is an older hotel but remodeled. Rooms were comfortable, nicely decorated. Comfy bed & pillows. We had a King Superior, with King bed, sofa, sofa table & desk area. Free Wi Fi in rooms which is a plus! Bathroom was very small, shower/tub combo & not much water pressure. Sink area outside bathroom was small too. Nice lobby & bar area. We had breakfast included with our room, you can choose a small hot buffet or cold items from a case. Great staff in bar. $21 to park your car each day. Rooms were pretty quiet, didn't hear any neighbors or water running. I probably would stay here again for the right price.
reviews.title: Terrible Service and Maintenance (NYE)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was definitely my worse hotel experience. Our group of 6 stayed here for NYE as none of us wanted to be the designated driver. Our plan was just to leave our bags and come back for the night after the night out. The building is definitely a little older, but it seems the hotel had a recent makeover, making it on par with other Holiday inn locations. However, the washrooms and applicances seem to have been the originals from when the hotel was built, and, unfortunately that is where our problems lay. The room, when we arrived was freezing. I had a maintenance manager come and inspect the heater and he advised that it was not something he could fix that night so he suggested a space heater. I was completely ok with that, but of course, the space heater never came. By the time we got back to the hotel, we were too tired to pursue it further, except we all woke up freezing.The toilet also did not flush which was a complete inconvenience when we found out in the morning. When we tried to call downstairs for assistance, the phone, of course did not work.
reviews.title: Recent upgrades move this hotel to above average

reviews.text: It most likely was one of their busiest nights of the year, but they certainly did little to remedy our disappointments upon check-out.

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights. Howe Street is in a reasonably good location, pretty close of shops, casual and fine dining resturants. Large shopping district is close by which is handy.
reviews.title: Cheap parking, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obvious rooms have been uprgraded and are more than adequate. Found room facilities fine and room reasonably good size. Also refridgerator in room which is handy also. hotel is slightly dated but fine
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel downtown Vancouver

reviews.text: Parking is additional, which is so much cheaper compared to other hotels. It is a secure public carpark for public and hotel guests but very secure. Room card access required which is good.
reviews.title: First time, would return

reviews.text: We were on the executive level and unfortunately a rowdy guest came home at 1am and was screaming, using discusting language, banging doors and ranting in the cooridor for quite some time fighting with his companions. He was obviously drunk and being totally inappropriate. Guests tried to calm him down themselves but he got aggressive. Guests complained and management and security tried to calm him down without sucess. Management tried their best and attempted to evict him but he refused to come out of his room and answer the door! They tried again with no sucess and left him to sleep it off and give the rest of the guests peace and quiet. This caused us to lose hours of sleep & we had to put up with a lunatic swearing and screaming which is not what you want when you stay in a hotel. The guest was a total idiot which is understand wasnt their fault but it does reflect on the hotel.
reviews.title: Going downhill very fast....

reviews.text: On check out we mentioned we had an awful experience and were given free parking after some negotiation. This was appreciated as it was a pretty ordinary experience
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location

aka: Holiday Inn Hotel And Suites Vancouver Downtown
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Vancouver Downtown Perfectly situated in the heart of downtown, our 100% smoke free Vancouver hotel is near Yaletown businesses & restaurants, Robson St. shopping and Granville St.entertainment. Corporate guests love our Vancouver hotel s convenient access to nearby businesses and convention centres, as well as our business amenities. Guests can work in the business centre, take advantage of the free high-speed Internet access and book a meeting room that can accommodate up to 250 people. Leisure guests are right in the middle of all the hot spots in downtown Vancouver. Our hotel's location offers the opportunity for strolling along Yaletown s Waterfront Seawall or taking a ferry across False Creek to Granville Island. You can catch a concert at BC Place or a Canucks game at GM Place. Broadway shows at the Elizabeth Theatre are terrific for a night out and the Centre for Performing Arts is a great choice, too. From wining and dining at UnWine d Dining Lounge to shopping at downtown boutiques, our Vancouver hotel is close to it all. You won t find the comfort and convenience of our accommodations at other Vancouver hotels. From a 24-hour fitness centre and indoor, heated pool to delicious dining options and comfortable amenities, we have it all. At the Holiday Inn Hotel Vancouver Downtown, our friendly, multi-lingual staff, known for outstanding hospitality, looks forward to welcoming you.
